title: How to Make Pixel Art in Pixelmator

steps.headline: Open Pixelmator from the bottom of you screen.
steps.description: Once you open it, a pop up will appear asking what photo you want to edit.

steps.headline: Click "New Document" at the bottom left.
Choose your desired preset, then click "OK".
If you are editing a pixel character, such as a Fantage character, choose "File" "Open" then select the image you want to use.
steps.description: If you are making your own, leave it blank.

steps.headline: Click "Pixelmator" on the top left corner, then select "Preferences".
Drag the "Pixel" tool into your toolbar, then click it to start use.
Click "View" then "Zoom In" at the top of the screen.
steps.description: Repeat at least three times. (Change for larger images if you are editing pre-made pixel art).

steps.headline: Change the diameter to you taste/needs.
Enjoy your final product!
steps.description: This is the final product editing remade pixel art! And this is the final product of original pixel art!

text: Open Pixelmator from the bottom of you screen. Once you open it, a pop up will appear asking what photo you want to edit. Click "New Document" at the bottom left.  Choose your desired preset, then click "OK".  If you are editing a pixel character, such as a Fantage character, choose "File" "Open" then select the image you want to use. If you are making your own, leave it blank. Click "Pixelmator" on the top left corner, then select "Preferences".  Select "Tools" and then "Painting".  Drag the "Pixel" tool into your toolbar, then click it to start use.  Click "View" then "Zoom In" at the top of the screen. Repeat at least three times. (Change for larger images if you are editing pre-made pixel art). Change the diameter to you taste/needs.  Enjoy your final product! This is the final product editing remade pixel art! And this is the final product of original pixel art!
